description.narrative: AMA- Association of the environment, was created on May 19, 1990 in the City of Pemba, Province of Cabo Delgado with the name of NUMA (Environmental Nucleus) and was recognized and authorized to operate by the Governor of the Province on 31 January 1991. It is registered in the Bulletinof the Republic No 20, Series III dated 16 May 2007. This NGO emerged from the union of young people motivated by the interest of safeguarding environmental resources, damage caused by erosion, indiscriminate overturning of forests, as wellas the protected species of animals. COSACA is undertaking the development of these training materials and will conduct the training in the context of strengthening our national partners to be more effective emergency response implementors. This training seeks tobetter prepare national partners to respond to emergencies and to have fundamental understanding of core humanitarian principles / standards as well as a good understanding of best practices. It can also be used to provide partner refresher and or strengthening training for those with whom we already work and can be extended to relevant government focal points so that they too can better understand our role as NGOs in emergency response.

participating-org.narrative:
AMA was original created in May 19, 1990 in the City of Pemba, Province of Cabo Delgado with the name of NUMA (Nucleus of the Environment) and was recognized and authorized to work by the Governor of the Province on January 31, 1991. In 2001 Its was registered asAMA - Associacão do Meio Ambiente . It is registered in the Bulletin of the Republic No 20, Series III , 16 May 2007.
AMA main objective is to protect the Environment thorough the sustainable use of natural resources (including extractive resources) for the well being of communities. AMA uses massive education and promotes the inclusion of communities in the decision making process related to improving their lives. For the project partnership with OXFAM, AMA will work in the community rights related to the exploitation of natural resources in the district of Palma and Nhamanumbir , in Cabo Delgado .

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
